name: Jicama Appetizer
instructions: Arrange jicama on a platter. Sprinkle lime juice and chili powder over the jicama. Serve immediately.

name: Instant Pot Spicy Beef Curry Stew
instructions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker and select Saute function.
Pour in olive oil and heat until sizzling, add meat and season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned, 5 to 7 minutes per side.
Transfer meat to a plate, reserving juices in the pot. Add jalapenos, garlic, and ginger to the pot.
Cook and stir until tender, about 2 minutes. Season with curry powder.
Pour 1/2 of the beef broth into the pot, scrape brown bits from the bottom of the pot using a wooden spoon.
Return meat to the pot with remaining beef broth, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, and onion. Close and lock the lid.
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions and set timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes.
Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes more.

name: Instant Pot Vegetable Soup
instructions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker and select Saute function.
Pour olive oil into the hot cooker and add carrots, celery, onion, and salt. Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Stir in garlic and red chile pepper, saute for 2 minutes. Add potatoes, tomatoes, kale, and zucchini.
Pour in vegetable broth, add bay leaf, and stir to combine. Close and lock the lid.
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions, set timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes more.
Unlock and remove the lid. Serve soup in bowls and top with lemon zest and parsley.

name: Keto Chicken Parm
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Slice each chicken breast in half horizontally to make 4 fillets. Generously season with Italian seasoning, onion powder, salt and pepper. Set aside.
In a shallow bowl, whisk together eggs, garlic and Italian seasoning. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Place chicken in the egg wash and set aside to let marinate.
Combine the parmesan cheese and almond flour in a separate shallow bowl.
Using a fork or tongs, pick up one of the chicken breast pieces and allow excess egg wash to drip off. Dredge in the parmesan mixture.
Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry chicken for 4 minutes per side.
Lightly grease a baking dish with non stick cooking oil spray. Spread half of the marinara over the base of a lightly greased baking dish.
Arrange chicken over the sauce in a single layer. Spread remaining sauce over each chicken breast. Top with the mozzarella and parmesan cheese.
Broil for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve.

name: Italian Omelette With Zucchini
instructions: Heat half of the olive oil in a frying pan. Add the zucchini and cook 5 min uncovered, stirring frequently.
Add salt and pepper, cover, and cook over low heat about 5 additional minutes.
Break 2 eggs directly into the pan, then stir, using a wooden spoon and cook 2 min over medium heat. Remove the pan from the heat.
In a large bowl, lightly beat the remaining eggs. Add almond flour.
Add the zucchini mixture to the beaten eggs. Add the grated cheese. Season with salt and pepper, then mix well.
Add the mixture, distributing it evenly over the skillet. Gently lift the edges with a spatula and push them towards the center. After 3 minutes, the bottom will be cooked to a nice crust.
Lower the heat to medium-low and continue to cook until the edges get darker, 15 minutes.
Gently lift the edges with a spatula and cover the skillet with a large plate.

name: Keto Beef And Broccoli Stir Fry
instructions: In a large skillet over high heat, add 1 tbsp avocado oil. Add in the sliced steak and brown on both sides. Remove from pan to a plate and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium and add in 1 tbsp avocado oil. Add in the broccoli florets and saute until tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the steak back to the pan with the broccoli. Add in the soy sauce, swerve, garlic, ginger and broth. Stir to combine and let thicken for a few minutes.
Serve immediately.

name: Khachapuri
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, combine the warm water, yeast, and pinch of sugar and stir. Then let it sit for 5 minutes until the yeast is foamy.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and sugar. Pour warm milk, foamy yeast, oil and knead for about 5 minutes.
Divide the dough into 3 equal pieces and roll into a ball. Roll each piece into oval shape. Arrange some feta and mozzarella cheese and roll sides up.
Crack an egg into each piece and bake for 15 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Italian Breakfast Casserole
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Place a medium skillet over medium heat. Add sausage and brown. When cooked, transfer to a baking dish. Discard leftover grease.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs well. Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour over sausage in baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Serve immediately.

name: Honey Garlic Salmon
instructions: Pat the salmon fillets dry with paper towels and season them all over with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the smoked paprika over the tops of the fillets.
Heat a large oven proof skillet over medium high heat and add the ghee. Place the salmon skin side down and sear for about 3 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together all the sauce ingredients until well combined.
Once the salmon is halfway done, pour the sauce into the skillet and spoon over the salmon. Cook for 5 minutes.

name: Insalata Casprese
instructions: On a large platter, alternate and overlap the tomato slices, mozzarella cheese slices, and basil leaves. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with sea salt and pepper.

name: Hoisin Glazed Salmon
instructions: Whisk together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chili sauce, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, and olive oil in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Place the salmon fillets into the marinade, and turn to evenly coat. Cover the dish with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Preheat an oven to 350°F.
Cook the rice in a pot od water accoriding to the instruction on the packaging.
Remove and discard the plastic wrap from the salmon, use a spoon to scoop up the marinade that has collected in the bottom of the baking dish, and drizzle it over the salmon fillets.
Bake in the preheated oven until the salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 30 minutes.

name: Korean Buchimgae Pancakes
instructions: Sieve the flour and the salt. Add the water and whisk it well. Add the eggs, Kimchi, Kimchi liquid and chilies. Mix them well.
Pre heat a skillet until well heated. Put a generous amount of cooking oil into the pan.
Scoop out the pancake mixture with a ladle, pour it out on the pan. Make sure it is evenly spread.
Turn the pancake over when 70% of the pancake is cooked. Add green onions.
When both sides are cooked, slice it into easy to bite-size. Serve.

name: Honey Walnut Shrimp
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a pot, add water, butter, and sugar. Turn the heat up to medium-high and mix until the sugar is fully dissolved.
Once the liquid starts boiling, add in walnuts and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Remove and set aside on some parchment paper.
Mix shrimp with tempura mix and cold sparkling water in a bowl.
Add oil to a pot and turn the heat up to medium-high. Once the oil is hot, add in the shrimp. Fry for 4 minutes and set aside.
In a bowl, add fried shrimp and candied walnuts and mix. Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Hunan Shrimp
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Clean the shrimp and marinate it with salt, pepper and arrowroot powder while you prep the rest of the ingredients.
Mix sambal oelek, oyster sauce, rice vinegar and tomato paste in a bowl.
Heat half of the oil in a wok over medium high heat. Add shrimp and sear for a couple of minutes, till they get a little curled up and turn pink. Set aside.
Add remaining oil and turn the heat to high. Add in green beans and broccoli. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes, till they get little soft.
Stir in bell peppers, white parts of scallions, ginger and garlic. Stir fry for 4 minutes, then mix in the prepared Hunan sauce.
Add some water along with shrimp and stir fry for another 3 minutes. Garnish it with green parts of scallions.

name: Instant Pot Vegan Lentil Soup
instructions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker and select Saute function.
Heat olive oil, cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Add carrots and celery and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
Combine lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, garlic, thyme, salt, paprika, and black pepper in the pot. Close and lock the lid.
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Serve in bowls and sprinkle with parsley.

name: Korean Cucumber Salad
instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together vinegar, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in sesame seeds, and reduce heat to medium. Cook until seeds are brown, about 5 minutes.
Remove seeds with a slotted spoon, and stir into vinegar mixture. Mix in cucumber, green onions, and carrot. Cover, and refrigerate at least 5 minutes.

name: Keto Meatball Casserole
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Combine beef, sausage, mozzarella, parmesan, egg, garlic pwoder, onion powder, and seasonings and mix thoroughly. Then, roll mixture into meatballs.
Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Drizzle oil in the skillet. Then, place meatballs into the skillet and cook for 2 mintues. Flip and cook for another 2 minutes.
Place the skillet into the preheated oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the skillet from the oven and pour the tomatoes and wine over the meatballs.
Return the skillet to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Italian Panzanella Bread Salad
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Toss bread chunks with avocado oil in a bowl. Spread bread on a a tray and toast for about 15 minutes. Remove and leave to cool.
Cut tomato into 8 wedges each. Cut some of these wedges into half. Put tomatoes into a colander over a large bowl. Season with the salt, toss and set aside.
Place tomato sweating in colander into large bowl. Add cucumber, onion and basil, toss gently.
Mix the remaining ingredients and whisk well. Add bread to salad, pour over dressing. Give it a light toss.
Leave for 5 minutes to let the juices soak into the bread, tossing once or twice. Serve immediately.

name: Kongnamool
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the bean sprouts, and cook uncovered until tender yet still crisp, about 15 seconds.
Drain in a colander, then immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes until cold to stop the cooking process.
Whisk soy sauce, sesame oil, chile powder, garlic, and sesame seeds together in a large bowl.
Stir in bean sprouts and toss until well coated with the sauce.
Sprinkle with green onions and season with rice wine vinegar. Refrigerate before serving.

name: Kimchi Soup
instructions: Combine kimchi, water, and garlic in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil.
Stir in pork belly, and hot sauce. Add tofu and mushrooms, stir carefully so you don't break up the tofu. Reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook until kimchi is softened and pork is slightly pink in the center, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Keto Golden Milk
instructions: Put all the ingredients into a blender.
Blend on high for 15-30 seconds. The longer you blend it for, the stronger the ginger and turmeric will be. Pour into glasses.
Sprinkle with a dash of cinnamon and serve right away.

name: Instant Pot Easy Vegan Tomato And Basil Soup
instructions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker and select Saute function.
Heat olive oil and add onion, cook until translucent, about 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Combine tomatoes, vegetable broth, basil, nutritional yeast, salt, ground black pepper, and Italian seasoning in the pot.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions, set timer for 5 minutes.
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.
Blend with an immersion blender until creamy.

name: Instant Pot Cabbage With Sausage
instructions: Pour chicken broth into the Instant Pot. Then add in the onion slices, smoked sausage, potatoes, cabbage and finally the butter.
Toss a bit and sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Cover the pot and lock the lid into place.
Cook for 20 minutes and serve.

name: Italian Pasta Soup
instructions: Put a large saucepan of water on to boil. Cook pasta in the boiling water according to a package directions and set aside.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, celery, carrot, and cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add Italian seasoning, salt, pepper and cook, about 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and their juices, broth and beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to maintain a lively simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in the pasta just before serving.

name: Korean Galbi
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb beef short ribs, cut flanken style
instructions: Place the ribs in a large stockpot and cover with cold water. Soak ribs, refrigerated, for 1 hour to pull out any blood. Drain.
Combine garlic, onion, and Asian pear in a blender and puree. Pour into a large bowl and stir in the soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, and black pepper.
Marinate ribs in the soy mixture, covered, overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
Grill ribs until the meat is tender and the outside is crusty, 5 to 10 minutes per side.

name: Italian Caponata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 360°F. Add eggplant on a baking tray and season with salt, pepper, and 1 tbsp of olive oil. Bake for 25 minutes.
Heat 1 olive oil in a pan and add onion and celery. Fry for 5 minutes and add 1/4 cup of water.
Add tomatoes, salt olives and capers, and cook for 10 minutes. Add vinegar and stir,
Add baked eggplants, stir, finish cooking for a couple of minutes, then turn the heat off, garnish with some pine nuts and serve.

name: Korean Crispy Chicken
instructions: Mix rice wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon garlic, 1 teaspoon ginger, salt, and 1 pinch pepper in a bowl with the chicken. Allow to sit for 20 to 30 minutes.
Combine vinegar, gochujang, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and 1 pinch black pepper in a pot over medium heat.
Stir well, when bubbling, reduce heat to low and simmer 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat.
Oil a pan with oil and heat to 350°F. Add chicken in small batches, making sure to not overcrowd the pan.
Cook until lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to the pot of sauce. Heat sauce and chicken over medium-low heat until warmed through, about 3 minutes.

name: Kale And Ginger Smoothie
ingredientLines: 1/2 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Pour almond or coconut milk into a blender and add chia seeds to allow the chia seeds to soak for 5 minutes.
Add all remaining ingredients and blend until chunks are liquified and the smoothie is the consistency you desire. Pour into large glasses and enjoy.

name: Japanese Okonomiyaki Pancake
instructions: Mix flour and water together in a bowl until smooth. Stir in cabbage, bacon, eggs, sausage, green onions, shrimp, and cheese.
Preheat a griddle to 400°F and coat with oil. Pour in flour mixture in the shape of a pancake. Cook 6 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving plate.
Mix soy sauce, tomato sauce, and vinegar together in a small bowl to make okonomiyaki sauce. Drizzle over pancake. Garnish with panko and mayonnaise.

name: Korean Chicken Dumplings
ingredientLines: 1/2 lb skinless, boneless chicken breasts, chopped
instructions: Combine rice wine, sesame oil, ginger paste, salt, and pepper together in a glass or ceramic bowl, add chicken and toss to coat.
Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Heat enough oil in a frying pan over medium heat to cover the chicken pieces.
Add chicken to the hot oil and fry until no longer pink in the centers, about 5 minutes.
Place a small amount of fried chicken inside each wrapper. Brush all edges with beaten egg and fold to seal. Set aside.
Heat more oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Pan-fry dumplings, working in batches as needed, until golden, 3 to 5 minutes.
Transfer dumplings to the baking sheet rack as you work to drain excess oil.
Whisk together gochujang, lime juice, sesame oil, garlic paste, and soy sauce for sauce in a bowl. Serve with dumplings.

name: Japanese Chicken-Egg Rice Bowl
ingredientLines: ½ onion, cut in half and sliced
instructions: Rinse the rice in 3 changes of water until the rinse water is almost clear, and drain off the rinse water. Bring the rice and 4 cups of water to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Place the chicken in a nonstick skillet with a lid, and cook and stir about 5 minutes. Stir in the onion, and cook and stir until the onion is soft, about 5 more minutes.
Pour in the stock, and whisk in soy sauce and mirin. Bring the mixture to a boil, and let simmer until slightly reduced, about 10 minutes.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl and pour over the chicken and stock. Cover the skillet, reduce heat, and steam for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
To serve, place some rice in bowls, top each bowl with some chicken and egg mixture, and spoon some soup into each bowl.

name: Instant Pot Spicy Vegan Carrot Soup
instructions: Combine carrots, vegetable broth, coconut milk, onion, garlic, curry paste, salt, and pepper in a multi-functional pressure cooker.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions, set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
Unlock and remove lid. Add nutritional yeast and blend soup with an immersion blender until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes.
Serve in bowls and sprinkle with chives.

name: Kalbi
instructions: In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce, water, garlic, green onions, and sesame oil until the sugar has dissolved.
Place the ribs in a large plastic zipper bag. Pour the marinade over the ribs, squeeze out all the air, and refrigerate the bag for 3 hours to overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
Remove the ribs from the bag, shake off the excess marinade, and discard the marinade.
Grill the ribs on the preheated grill until the meat is still pink but not bloody nearest the bone, 5 to 7 minutes per side.

name: Korean Beef
instructions: In a large bowl, stir together the soy sauce, sugar, sesame seeds, sesame oil, shallots, garlic, and mirin.
Add the meat, and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the meat for 5 to 10 minutes, or until no longer pink.

name: Italian Tomato Bean Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a soup pot. Add chopped onion and garlic. Cook for a minute.
Add crushed tomato, tomato paste, basil, salt, pepper, bay leaf, and stock to the pot. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in ½ cup of white beans to the pot. Using a hand blender blitz everything until smooth.
Stir in the rest of the bean to the soup. Give everything a good mix.

name: Korean Bean Curd Soup
instructions: In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine water, miso, garlic paste, dashi and gochujang.
Bring to a boil and let boil 2 minutes. Stir in zucchini, potato, mushrooms and onions and let boil 5 to 7 minutes more.
Stir in tofu and cook until tofu has expanded and vegetables are tender.

name: Hot And Sour Shrimp Soup
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Bring broth to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and shrimp and cook until shrimp have heated through, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the fish sauce, lime juice, green onion, cilantro and chile pepper. Taste and adjust salt and pepper if needed.
Soup should be sour, salty, spicy and hot. Serve imemdiately.

name: Kimchi Pancakes
instructions: In a mixing bowl, add the kimchi. Use kitchen shears to cup it into small bits then add the rest of the ingredients.
Whisk and combine well. The batter will be on the thin side.
Preheat skillet, add oil and swirl it around. Take ½ cup of the batter and add it to the pan and immediately use the back of a spoon to spread it.
Cook over medium-low heat about 2 minutes on the first side and 1 minute on the second side. Repeat the process until you finish the batter.

name: Keto Shrimp Salad
ingredientLines: ¼ cup red onion, finely chopped
instructions: Heat the butter over medium-high heat in a frying pan. Add the shrimp and cook them, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes; set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk the sour cream until smooth. While whisking, slowly stream in the lemon juice.
Whisk in the garlic, mustard, dill, salt, and pepper. Taste and adjust seasonings. Stir in the cooked shrimp, cucumber, and celery.

name: Instant Pot Butternut Squash And Pumpkin Spice Soup
instructions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker and select Saute function. Heat oil and add onion.
Saute until translucent, about 2 minutes, be careful not to brown the onion. Move onion to the side of the pot.
Add a layer of butternut squash to the bottom of the pot. Brown slightly, about 4 minutes.
Add remaining butternut squash, curry powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Mix and continue cooking until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Pour broth and applesauce into the pot with the butternut squash mixture. Close and lock the lid, set knob to sealing.
Select high pressure and set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.
Mix pumpkin puree and ghee into the pot with the soup. Blend with a stick blender. Add salt. Mix thoroughly.

name: Keto Potato Salad
instructions: Transfer cauliflower and broccoli to a microwave-safe dish. Cover and cook on high until tender, about 6 minutes.
Mix mayonnaise, yogurt, onion, pickle relish, nutritional yeast, mustard, salt, and pepper into the cauliflower and broccoli.
Mash slightly to get a creamier consistency. Chill before serving.

name: Italian Soup With Meatballs
instructions: In a mixing bowl, add the ground chicken, bread crumbs, egg,  Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper. Stir until combined. Roll into one-inch meatballs.
In a large pot add the olive oil, onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes or until tender.
Add in the chicken broth, pasta, and meatballs and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes until meatballs are cooked through and pasta is tender.
Stir in spinach, parsley and allow to wilt. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Kale Pesto Chicken
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Begin by preparing the pesto. Add kale, flaxseed oil, garlic, pine nuts, lemon juice, Parmesan and salt to a food processor and puree until well combined.
Season the pesto to taste with salt and pepper, an extra squirt of lemon if needed, and set aside.
Prepare to cook the chicken. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper generously on each side and drizzle chicken with a little splash of olive oil.
Add the chicken to the grill, cooking on both sides for about 5 minutes, until tender and cooked through with an internal temperature of 165°F.
To serve, spread the kale pesto over each chicken breast.

name: Keto Cheesy Spinach Bake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Set the spinach in a colander and pour over boiling water to just wilt the spinach. Drain and set aside.
Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the cream, mozzarella, salt and pepper. Heat through, stirring to melt the cheeses until you have a thick sauce.
Add the spinach to the pan and stir well to combine.
Spoon the creamy spinach mixture into a small oven dish in an even layer. Sprinkle over the grated parmesan. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Keto Chicken Enchilada Casserole
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
½ lb boneless, skinless chicken breast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F.
Combine the beef and enchilada sauce in a medium saucepan and simmer for 5 minutes over medium-low heat.
Then flip the chicken over, cover and cook for an additional 10 minutes. Remove chicken from pan and shred into bite-sized pieces.
Combine shredded chicken, the enchilada sauce, feta, chilis and cilantro in a bowl. Add salt and pepper.
Spray a square casserole dish with olive oil and coat the entire bottom and sides. Evenly spread 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese on the bottom of the dish.
Add the chicken mixture, then add the other cup of cheddar cheese on top. Cover with foil and bake for about 10 minutes.
Remove foil and bake an additional 3 minutes to melt the cheese.

name: Keto Salmon Alfredo
instructions: Drizzle olive oil in skillet and heat it up. Sprinkle salt and pepper over the salmon filet. Cook the salmon about 5 minutes on each side until done.
Meanwhile get a large skillet and melt the butter with the crushed garlic. Mix in the cream cheese, cooking cream and parmesan cheese.
Whisk and cook until the cheeses melt and everything is blended.
When the salmon is done, chop up into pieces. Whisk it into cheese sauce.
Place zucchini noodles on a plate. Top with sauce and serve.

name: Keto Zuppa Toscana
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large pot, cook sausage until no pink remains. Drain and set aside. Cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain on a paper towel and drain fat from the pan.
Add in cauliflower, kale, chicken stock, crushed peppers, and sausage. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 6 minutes. Stir in heavy cream and pepper and let simmer 2 minutes. Garnish with bacon and serve immediately.

name: Keto Garlic-Shrimp Zoodles
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Spiralize the zucchini. Set aside.
Add the olive oil and lemon juice to a skillet on medium heat. Once the pan is warm, add the shrimp. Cook the shrimp for one minute per side.
Add the garlic. Cook for an additional minute, stirring often. Add the zucchini noodles and stirconstantly for 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with the chopped parlsey. Serve immediately.

name: Korean Braised Potatoes
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
½ lb potatoes, peeled and chopped
instructions: Add all the garlic, soy sauce, mirin, salt, pepper and water to a bowl and whisk together. Set aside.
Add oil to a pot or pan and saute the potatoes over medium high heat for 4 minutes. Mix it around and flip the potatoes when you start to hear the bottom sizzle.
Once potatoes are pan fried on all sides, add braising sauce. Bring it to boil over high heat.
Stir, cover and reduce to medium heat and let it braise stirring occasionally. After 5 minutes, increase heat to medium high and cook until sauce thickens.
Drizzle with sesame oil, sesame seeds and serve imemdiately.

name: Keto Clam Chowder
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Melt 2 tbsp of ghee in large stock pot with a cover. Add onions and cook until translucent.
Add ¾ of the cauliflower to the pot, reserve ¼ of the cauliflower for later.
Add the chicken broth, water, salt, and remaining ghee. Bring to a boil, reduce to medium heat, cover, and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove the pot from the heat, carefully place entire mixture into a large blender. Blend until completely smooth.
Pour the blended mixture back into the pot. Stir in the cauliflower, clams, and rosemary. Bring pot to a simmer and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.
